title: First Trailer for Marvel TV's 'Ironheart' Series Feat. Dominique Thorne
description: "I want to build something undeniable. Something..." "Important?" "Iconic." Marvel has launched the first official trailer for a new Marvel Television mini-series called Ironheart, a spin-off from the Black Panther: Wakanda Forever movie. The series set in Chicago focuses on genius teenage inventor Riri Williams, who creates the most advanced suit of armor since Iron Man. Riri returns home where she gets entangled with the enigmatic Parker Robbins aka "The Hood", discovering secrets that pit technology against magic, setting her on a path of danger & adventure. The series is launching in June, a one-off creation produced by Ryan Coogler following his work on the Black Panther movies. I guess it took a few years for this series to come together while he was out filming Sinners. Ironheart stars Dominique Thorne as "Ironheart", Anthony Ramos, Lyric Ross, Alden Ehrenreich, Regan Aliyah, Manny Montana, Matthew Elam, and Anji White. This looks pretty cool. There's some good storytelling in this. But also seems like Disney is getting a bit afraid people are losing interest after Iron Man is gone so they're kinda sorta bringing back Iron Man – even though it's not actually Iron Man. Iron Woman? Sure, why not, let's roll […]
author: Alex Billington
excerpt: "I want to build something undeniable. Something..." "Important?" "Iconic." Marvel has launched the first official trailer for a new Marvel Television mini-series called Ironheart, a spin-off from the Black Panther: Wakanda Forever movie. The series set in Chicago focuses on genius teenage inventor Riri Williams, who creates the most advanced suit of armor since Iron
text: by May 14, 2025Source: YouTube "I want to build something undeniable. Something..." "Important?" "Iconic." Marvel has launched the first official trailer for a new Marvel Television mini-series called Ironheart, a spin-off from the Black Panther: Wakanda Forever movie. The series set in Chicago focuses on genius teenage inventor Riri Williams, who creates the most advanced suit of armor since Iron Man. Riri returns home where she gets entangled with the enigmatic Parker Robbins aka "The Hood", discovering secrets that pit technology against magic, setting her on a path of danger & adventure. The series is launching in June, a one-off creation produced by Ryan Coogler following his work on the Black Panther movies. I guess it took a few years for this series to come together while he was out filming Sinners. Ironheart stars Dominique Thorne as "Ironheart", Anthony Ramos, Lyric Ross, Alden Ehrenreich, Regan Aliyah, Manny Montana, Matthew Elam, and Anji White. This looks pretty cool. There's some good storytelling in this. But also seems like Disney is getting a bit afraid people are losing interest after Iron Man is gone so they're kinda sorta bringing back Iron Man – even though it's not actually Iron Man. Iron Woman? Sure, why not, let's roll with that. Check it out below. Here's the first official trailer for Marvel TV's series Ironheart, direct from Marve's YouTube: Set after the events of Black Panther: Wakanda Forever, Marvel's Ironheart series pits technology against magic when Riri Williams (Dominique Thorne)—a young, genius inventor determined to make her mark on the world—returns to her hometown of Chicago. Her unique take on building iron suits is brilliant, but in pursuit of her ambitions, she finds herself wrapped up with mysterious yet charming Parker Robbins aka "The Hood" (Anthony Ramos). Ironheart is a series created by writer Chinaka Hodge, a writer on the "Snowpiercer" & "The Midnight Club" series previously. With writing by Chinaka Hodge, Francesca & Jacqueline Gailes, Malarie Howard, Cristian Martinez, Amir Sulaiman. Based on the Marvel comics created by Brian Michael Bendis & Mike Deodato Jr. Featuring episodes directed by Samantha Bailey and Angela Barnes. Produced by Marvel Television & Proximity Media. And executive produced by Kevin Feige, Louis D’Esposito, Brad Winderbaum, Zoie Nagelhout, Chinaka Hodge, Ryan Coogler, Sev Ohanian, Zinzi Coogler. Marvel will debut Ironheart streaming on Disney+ starting June 24th, 2025 this summer. Anyone into it? Find more posts in: Marvel, Streaming, To Watch, Trailer
html:
by
May 14, 2025
Source: YouTube

"I want to build something undeniable. Something..." "Important?" "Iconic." Marvel has launched the first official trailer for a new Marvel Television mini-series called Ironheart, a spin-off from the Black Panther: Wakanda Forever movie. The series set in Chicago focuses on genius teenage inventor Riri Williams, who creates the most advanced suit of armor since Iron Man. Riri returns home where she gets entangled with the enigmatic Parker Robbins aka "The Hood", discovering secrets that pit technology against magic, setting her on a path of danger & adventure. The series is launching in June, a one-off creation produced by Ryan Coogler following his work on the Black Panther movies. I guess it took a few years for this series to come together while he was out filming Sinners. Ironheart stars Dominique Thorne as "Ironheart", Anthony Ramos, Lyric Ross, Alden Ehrenreich, Regan Aliyah, Manny Montana, Matthew Elam, and Anji White. This looks pretty cool. There's some good storytelling in this. But also seems like Disney is getting a bit afraid people are losing interest after Iron Man is gone so they're kinda sorta bringing back Iron Man – even though it's not actually Iron Man. Iron Woman? Sure, why not, let's roll with that. Check it out below.

Here's the first official trailer for Marvel TV's series Ironheart, direct from Marve's YouTube:

Set after the events of Black Panther: Wakanda Forever, Marvel's Ironheart series pits technology against magic when Riri Williams (Dominique Thorne)—a young, genius inventor determined to make her mark on the world—returns to her hometown of Chicago. Her unique take on building iron suits is brilliant, but in pursuit of her ambitions, she finds herself wrapped up with mysterious yet charming Parker Robbins aka "The Hood" (Anthony Ramos). Ironheart is a series created by writer Chinaka Hodge, a writer on the "Snowpiercer" & "The Midnight Club" series previously. With writing by Chinaka Hodge, Francesca & Jacqueline Gailes, Malarie Howard, Cristian Martinez, Amir Sulaiman. Based on the Marvel comics created by Brian Michael Bendis & Mike Deodato Jr. Featuring episodes directed by Samantha Bailey and Angela Barnes. Produced by Marvel Television & Proximity Media. And executive produced by Kevin Feige, Louis D’Esposito, Brad Winderbaum, Zoie Nagelhout, Chinaka Hodge, Ryan Coogler, Sev Ohanian, Zinzi Coogler. Marvel will debut Ironheart streaming on Disney+ starting June 24th, 2025 this summer. Anyone into it?

Find more posts in: Marvel, Streaming, To Watch, Trailer
